name: 'The Warfare Of Genghis Khan' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: During the meeting in the Oval Office the morning the nuclear blast was seen in the situation room, who was late to the meeting?
questions.explanation:
CIA director.

	The meeting was being held at 4 A.M. and the CIA director came in late saying that he couldn't find a way to the White House because of road construction. The President told Leo he didn't have much confidence in a person who couldn't find a way to the White House at 4 A.M.

questions.text: What country's ambassador did Leo meet to accuse them of using nuclear weapons?
questions.explanation:
Iran.

	Leo and Nancy met with the Iranian Ambassador at the Swiss Embassy so Leo could tell him that they knew Israel was testing nuclear weapons.

questions.text: What did Toby tell Leo he wanted to give the Vice President to work on?
questions.explanation:
Pot holes.

	Leo went to Toby to see what they could give the Vice President to work on so he would stay out of the nuclear bomb situation. Toby said he would let the VP work on potholes and Leo misunderstood him. Leo thought Toby meant infrastructure when Toby actually meant pot holes.

questions.text: While star gazing with Alex, Josh told her that he had a star named after him and his girlfriend. How long after the star was named after them, did they break up?
questions.explanation:
6 months.

	After hearing Josh's story about his girlfriend Linda, Alex told him that she also had a star named after her and her boyfriend at the time named Guillermo.

questions.text: When Charlie asked the President if he would have ordered the Atomic bomb be dropped on Hiroshima, did the President say yes?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The President avoided answering Charlie's question at first and when Charlie asked it again, the President didn't say anything at all.

questions.text: What is the missing word in this quote by CJ? "What girl can resist being referred to as ______?"
questions.explanation:
Poultry.

	CJ had just heard from Steve that Taylor Reid called her a chicken on his show and Steve wanted to know if CJ was going to appear on his show.

questions.text: When Alex mentioned they were all stardust, what did Josh say they actually were?
questions.explanation:
Nuclear waste.

	Josh and Alex were looking at the Orion Nebula when she quoted the  Joni Mitchell song. Josh corrected her by saying they were actually nuclear waste

questions.text: When Carol gave CJ the message that involved chicken noises, who did Carol say sent the message?
questions.explanation:
Danny.

	Carol tried to do the chicken noises, but she said she couldn't do it justice. After the message from Danny, CJ requested a copy of the Taylor Reid show. When she saw the talk show host talking about her on TV, she told Toby she wanted a piece of him.

questions.text: Whose music did Josh not mention when he was telling Donna that an assortment of music was being sent into outer space?
questions.explanation:
Kenny G.

	Josh (to Donna): "Voyager, in case it's ever encountered by extra-terrestrials is carrying photos of life on Earth, greetings in 55 languages and a collection of music from Gregorian chants to Chuck Berry. Including "Dark Was The Night, Cold Was The Ground" by '20s blues man Blind Willie Johnson, whose stepmother blinded him when he was seven by throwing lye in is his eyes after his father had beat her for being with another man. He died, penniless, of pneumonia after sleeping bundled in wet newspapers in the ruins of his house that burned down. But his music just left the solar system."

questions.text: Who did the Vice President tell Leo was actually behind the nuclear blast seen on the screen in the situation room?
questions.explanation:
Israel.

	The Vice President told Leo and the others in the situation room that an Israeli host once told him that they had nuclear powered submarines in the Mediterranean sea.
